page.title: 01GAWSWORTH
page.content: ]Gawsworth.Site and Situation. Gawsworth is a small village lying on the Cheshire plain in the east of the county.Its height above sea level is 500 feet. The village sits on a plateau between two raised pieces of land, to the north Gawsmoor Hill and to the south the Mount. The highest land lies to the east bordering on the Pennine hills, while to the west flat farming land stretches out on the plain. There are several features which should be noted, the Gawsworth block is bisected by Ben brook which joins Gandys brook in the south.To the east a large area of marsh waste land occurs, Danes Moss. The development of the village is on a north/south axis. The landscape is predominantly rural with minimal urban development.
